alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 10:29AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Fire Weather Concerns Exist Across Northern New York This Afternoon and Wednesday. Fine fuels remain very dry across portions of northern New York according to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation. This, combined with low relative humidity values of 20 to 30 percent and gusty winds of up to 25 mph may have an impact on fire weather conditions. If any fires were to start the weather and fuel conditions could cause fires to quickly get out of control and be difficult to contain. Although the NYS burn ban is no longer in effect, burning is not recommended due to these conditions. For more information about the current fire danger rating, any burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
